Study Title: Comparison of Melphalan-Prednisone (MP) to MP Plus Thalidomide in the Treatment of Newly Diagnosed Very Elderly Patients (> 75 Years) With Multiple Myeloma
Brief Summary: In multiple myeloma, combination chemotherapy with melphalan plus prednisone has been usedsince the 1960s and is regarded as the standard of care in very elderly patients. We assess whether the addition of thalidomide at 100 mg/day to this combination would improve survival.
Interventions: DRUG: Thalidomide|DRUG: melphalan, prednisone|DRUG: melphalan, prednisone, thalidomide
Secondary Outcome Measures: Progression Free Survival, May 2007|Response rates, May 2007|Safety, May 2007
Study Design: Allocation: RANDOMIZED|Intervention Model: PARALLEL|Masking: DOUBLE|Primary Purpose: TREATMENT
Locations: CHU Nancy - Brabois, rue du morvan, Vandoeuvre, 54511, France
